definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: Conflicts in its north Caucasus republics have flared again.
sentences.chinese: 北高加索共和國地區的衝突硝煙又起。

sentences.english: Smoke curled over the burning wreckage.
sentences.chinese: 硝煙瀰漫在燃燒的殘船上。

sentences.english: By that I mean they want to bring about the peaceful evolution of socialist countries towards capitalism.
sentences.chinese: 所謂沒有硝煙，就是要社會主義國家和平演變。

sentences.english: The log-house was full of smoke, to which we owed our comparative safety.
sentences.chinese: 木屋裏瀰漫着硝煙，多虧了這，我們還算安全些。

sentences.english: Just like refugees, oppressors often flee at the end of conflict.
sentences.chinese: 與難民類似，這些壓迫者經常逃到遠離硝煙的地方。

sentences.english: Smoke caused by explosions rises over Gaza City.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸引起的硝煙在加沙城上空騰起。

sentences.english: Their search is the last gasp of the post-war hunt for Nazi war criminals.
sentences.chinese: 警方的搜捕表明戰後抓捕納粹戰犯的硝煙未散。

definition: lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
smoke signal indicating the presence of hostile forces
to break out (of disease etc)/to suddenly get rich (or prominent)
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
ready to start on sth/about to act
soldiers munity and troops rebel (idiom); turmoil and chaos of war
